verses.verse: Dead <S%H4194><s%> <S%H2070>flies<s%> cause the <S%H8081>ointment<s%> of the <S%H7543>apothecary<s%> to send <S%H5042>forth<s%> a stinking <S%H887>savor:<s%> so doth a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H5531>folly<s%> him that is in <S%H3368>reputation<s%> for <S%H4480>wisdom<s%> <S%H2451><s%> and <S%H4480>honor.<s%> <S%H3519><s%>
A wise <S%H2450>man's<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%> is at his right <S%H3225>hand;<s%> but a <S%H3684>fool's<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%> at his <S%H8040>left.<s%>

Yea <S%H1571>also,<s%> when he that is a <S%H7945>fool<s%> <S%H5530><s%> <S%H1980>walketh<s%> by the <S%H1870>way,<s%> his <S%H3820>wisdom<s%> <S%H2638>faileth<s%> him, and he <S%H559>saith<s%> to every <S%H3605>one<s%> that <S%H1931>he<s%> is a <S%H5530>fool.<s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the <S%H7307>spirit<s%> of the <S%H4910>ruler<s%> rise <S%H5927>up<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> thee, <S%H5117>leave<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> thy <S%H4725>place;<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> <S%H4832>yielding<s%> <S%H5117>pacifieth<s%> <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H2399>offenses.<s%>

There <S%H3426>is<s%> an <S%H7451>evil<s%> which I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H8478>under<s%> the <S%H8121>sun,<s%> as an <S%H7684>error<s%> which <S%H7945>proceedeth<s%> <S%H3318><s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> <S%H6440><s%> the ruler: <S%H7989><s%>
Folly <S%H5529><s%> is <S%H5414>set<s%> in <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H4791>dignity,<s%> and the <S%H6223>rich<s%> <S%H3427>sit<s%> in low <S%H8216>place.<s%>
I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H5650>servants<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> <S%H5483>horses,<s%> and <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H1980>walking<s%> as <S%H5650>servants<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H776>earth.<s%>
He that <S%H2658>diggeth<s%> a <S%H1475>pit<s%> shall <S%H5307>fall<s%> into it; and whoso <S%H6555>breaketh<s%> a <S%H1447>hedge,<s%> a <S%H5175>serpent<s%> shall <S%H5391>bite<s%> him.
Whoso <S%H5265>removeth<s%> <S%H68>stones<s%> shall be <S%H6087>hurt<s%> therewith; and he that <S%H1234>cleaveth<s%> <S%H6086>wood<s%> shall be <S%H5533>endangered<s%> thereby.

If <S%H518><s%> the <S%H1270>iron<s%> be <S%H6949>blunt,<s%> and <S%H1931>he<s%> do <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H7043>whet<s%> the <S%H6440>edge,<s%> then must he put <S%H1396>to<s%> more <S%H2428>strength:<s%> but <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> is <S%H3504>profitable<s%> to <S%H3787>direct.<s%>
Surely <S%H518><s%> the <S%H5175>serpent<s%> will <S%H5391>bite<s%> <S%H3808>without<s%> <S%H3908>enchantment;<s%> and a <S%H1167>babbler<s%> <S%H3956><s%> is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H3504>better.<s%>
The <S%H1697>words<s%> of a wise <S%H2450>man's<s%> <S%H6310>mouth<s%> are <S%H2580>gracious;<s%> but the <S%H8193>lips<s%> of a <S%H3684>fool<s%> will swallow <S%H1104>up<s%> himself.

The <S%H8462>beginning<s%> of the <S%H1697>words<s%> of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> is <S%H5531>foolishness:<s%> and the <S%H319>end<s%> of his <S%H6310>talk<s%> is <S%H7451>mischievous<s%> <S%H1948>madness.<s%>

A <S%H5530>fool<s%> also is <S%H7235>full<s%> of <S%H1697>words:<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H3045>tell<s%> what shall <S%H4100>be;<s%> <S%H7945><s%> <S%H1961><s%> and <S%H834>what<s%> shall <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H4480>after<s%> <S%H310><s%> him, <S%H4310>who<s%> can <S%H5046>tell<s%> him?

The <S%H5999>labor<s%> of the <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H3021>wearieth<s%> every one of them, <S%H834>because<s%> he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> how to <S%H1980>go<s%> <S%H413>to<s%> the <S%H5892>city.<s%>
Woe <S%H337><s%> to thee, O <S%H776>land,<s%> when thy <S%H7945>king<s%> <S%H4428><s%> is a <S%H5288>child,<s%> and thy <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H398>eat<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning!<s%>

Blessed <S%H835><s%> art thou, O <S%H776>land,<s%> when thy <S%H7945>king<s%> <S%H4428><s%> is the <S%H1121>son<s%> of <S%H2715>nobles,<s%> and thy <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H398>eat<s%> in due <S%H6256>season,<s%> for <S%H1369>strength,<s%> and <S%H3808>not<s%> for <S%H8358>drunkenness!<s%>
By much <S%H6103>slothfulness<s%> the <S%H4746>building<s%> <S%H4355>decayeth;<s%> and through <S%H8220>idleness<s%> of the <S%H3027>hands<s%> the <S%H1004>house<s%> droppeth <S%H1811>through.<s%>

A <S%H3899>feast<s%> is <S%H6213>made<s%> for <S%H7814>laughter,<s%> and <S%H3196>wine<s%> maketh <S%H8055>merry:<s%> <S%H2416><s%> but <S%H3701>money<s%> <S%H6030>answereth<s%> <S%H853><s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> things.

Curse <S%H7043><s%> <S%H408>not<s%> the <S%H4428>king,<s%> <S%H1571>no<s%> not in thy <S%H4093>thought;<s%> and <S%H7043>curse<s%> <S%H408>not<s%> the <S%H6223>rich<s%> in thy <S%H2315>bedchamber:<s%> <S%H4904><s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> a <S%H5775>bird<s%> of the <S%H8064>air<s%> shall <S%H1980>carry<s%> <S%H853><s%> the <S%H6963>voice,<s%> and that which <S%H1167>hath<s%> <S%H3671>wings<s%> shall <S%H5046>tell<s%> the <S%H1697>matter.<s%>
